detaileddescription.para: macro to represent the ssid of the device in WPS_PBC and WPS_PIN Security mode
This is the Enrollee PIN that must be entered in the router for WPS PIN Connection. The pin code is stored in the SFlash. The default pin code is 35072317.
Macro to represent Initialized state of Wlan
The max buffer for storing the MAC address length
The max buffer for storing the scan data
The max buffer for storing the SSID length
Macro to represent un-Initialized state of Wlan Macro to represent the blocking connection request timeout
Connected and IPV4 address acquired
Connected and IPV4 address not acquired
Disconnected and IPV4 address acquired
Disconnected and IPV4 address not acquired
Different status for the Current Network Configuration function callback
Lowest power mode. Memories are not retained and only RTC will run.
Device wakeup from sleep mode or hibernate mode
Device will first try to reestablish previous connection without scan
Device will start or stop sending the mDNS packets

briefdescription.para: Enumeration to represent the different power modes.

detaileddescription.para: No available networks
Disconnected already
Connection error
Password error while connecting
IP address not acquired
Disconnect error
Error from Simplelink library
Error while creating timer
Error while starting timer
Error while get timer value
sl_Stop failed
Simplelink mode set failed
Failed to set simplelink policy
mDNS packets send already started
mDNS packets send already stopped

briefdescription.para: Enumeration to represent the return codes of WLAN module.

detaileddescription.para: Wlan status Connected
Wlan status Disconnected
Wlan status Connection error
Wlan status password error while connecting
Wlan status Disconnection error
Type defining callback status. This type is used for different connection status for the WLAN Connect function callback.
Type defining scan interval. This type is used for WlanNetworkConnect_scanNetworks function

Type defining the prototype which connection call back must conform to. This call back is called to notify the user when connection is established or Disconnection occurs. Returns the connection status as a parameter
Type defining a pointer to char This type is used in order to pass the network Pass Phrase
Type defining a pointer to char. This type is used in order to pass the network SSID
Type defining a pointer to char. This type is used in order to pass the network Username

briefdescription.para: WLAN driver de-initialization function. Performs memory deallocation, closes WLAN driver context and shuts down the hardware interfaces.

detaileddescription.para:
none
Retcode_T The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code) Below shows the error code(last 2 Bytes) meaning
RETCODE_OK - Successfully WLAN driver de-initialized.
RETCODE_SIMPLELINK_ERROR - De-initializing WLAN driver failed
RETCODE_UNEXPECTED_BEHAVIOR - FreeRTOS timer delete failure Example1 usage: Deinitialize the WLAN Stack //DeinitializeWLANstack WlanNetworkConnect_DeInit();

briefdescription.para: WLAN Delete All Profiles interface. This function erases from memory all the stored profiles from WIFI Protected Setup functions.
WLAN disconnect interface. This function disconnects from the WLAN network. Function is configurable in two ways: callback parameter is set to the address of the user function.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK successfully disconnected from Access point.

briefdescription.para: WLAN Connect to Enterprise WPA Network interface. This function connects to an WPA2-PSK or WPA-PSK network. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

briefdescription.para: Function to get the connection status. This function return the connection status.

simplesect.para: WLANNWCT_NOT_INITIALZED - Wlan module is not initialized.

briefdescription.para: Function to get the current network status This function sets a disconnect callback which is used to notify the user that there has been a disconnection that was not triggered by the user.ed on connection status.

detaileddescription.para: This API must be called only after initialization

briefdescription.para: Function to get the connection status. This function return the connection status.

WLAN driver initialization function. This function initializes WLAN driver context and Hardware interfaces; Also initializes the WLAN Stack. This API should be called first before calling any other API.
WLAN Connect to Open Network interface. This function connects to an open network. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

briefdescription.para: WLAN Connect to Personal WPA Network interface. This function connects to an WPA2-PSK or WPA-PSK network. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

parameterdescription.para: - data based on the power mode that is being notified | mode | data |

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in the case of success or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Function used to scan the available networks. Get the available scan information. List of scan results will be available via the call back function.

parameterdescription.para: Structure pointer hold the WLAN scan information data.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_NO_NW_AVAILABLE - No network available to scan.

briefdescription.para: WLAN Connect to WEP Open Network interface. This function connects to an WEP Open network. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

briefdescription.para: WLAN Connect using WPS PBC interface. This function connects to a network by using the Wi-Fi Protected Setup. After calling the function the user must push the connect button of the Router for around 5 seconds. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

briefdescription.para: WLAN Connect using WPS PIN interface. This function connects to a network by using the Wi-Fi Protected Setup. The function is configured with the following enrollee PIN code: 35072317. This PIN must be entered in the router interface after calling the function. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK - API return code for success.
RETCODE_SIMPLELINK_ERROR - Failure returned by simplelink API.
RETCODE_CONNECTION_ERROR - Connection Failure because of incorrect Pin.
RETCODE_ERROR_IP_NOT_ACQ - Connected but IP not acquired
